programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The Ethiopian Mountain world is ruled by two very different queens, but both mothers raising daughters. programme.title: Sky Sharks

programme.title: Planet Carnivore: Perfect Killers

programme.title: Queens

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: It's the county fair season! The Pol‚Äôs plan to get at least two cows and six sheep at the auction, but they have a lot to do before that can happen. First up, they must install a new perimeter fence. Charles and Ben think they are off to a good start, but when Dr. Pol points out how sneaky sheep can be, their workload doubles. Meanwhile, Beth is hoping for a goat at the small animal auction.

programme.title: Sharks Of The North
programme.desc: Sightings of great white sharks have been on the rise in Atlantic Canada. Alanna Canaran, a passionate science educator and dive instructor, embarks on a mission to unravel the enigmas surrounding these magnificent creatures and is determined to dispel fear of sharks in Nova Scotians. As the journey unfolds, Canaran and her team dive into the history of human-shark relationships along the coast.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: In Africa's vast Serengeti Plain, one million wildebeest are taking a rare pause for the mothers to have their young in a massive birthing event. .

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: When you've got it all, why would you give it all up? We expect animals to take the path of least resistance -- choosing the easiest and surest ways to get food, safety and comfort. But animals aren't always so predictable.

programme.title: Snake City
programme.desc: It‚Äôs the height of black mamba season in South Africa and the team splits up to deal with all the calls. Sioux and Mbali face a feisty black mamba alone while Simon wrestles an enormous specimen solo. Some once-in-a-lifetime snake surprises feature in this episode, but nothing can prepare the trio for the epic rescue of an elusive, deadly boomslang stuck in a roof.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Forget the birds and the bees, Ryan reveals the steps to finding ‚Äúthe one,‚Äù underdog style. From first attraction in giant-nosed proboscis monkeys to the importance of wingmen in turkey courtship or even foreplay with flying foxes, these animals are rewriting the rule book on messy and complicated relationships in the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Ryan Reynolds reveals some highly questionable parenting strategies from the animal kingdom‚Äôs worst parents, the underdogs. From a goose who lays their eggs on the top of a cliff to a koala that feeds its baby poop, it‚Äôs uncertain if they bad parents or just misunderstood. But no matter how bad one thinks they may be at parenting; they can‚Äôt be as bad as these guys.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Pol welcomes a new vet to the clinic just in time to help the team with a wave of cases. Dr. Pol treats a local K9 deputys injured paw, Dr. Nicole examines a service dog after a scuffle, Dr. Lisa stitches up a horse with a large laceration, and Dr. Brenda soothes a cats burned limb. On her second day on the job, Dr. Olivia jumps into action and helps Dr. Lisa with a cow in labor. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Dr. Brenda and Dr. Pol team up on a challenging farm call. The dire situation turns into an emergency for one of their own. Dr. Lisa diagnoses a cat with an uncommon condition, Dr. Brenda is called out for a rare reindeer birth and Dr. Pols strength and ingenuity are tested to help save the life of a new momma cow. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: Great Danes, Friesians, and rats, oh my! It‚Äôs all about the vet‚Äôs pets. These animal loving docs rely on experience to heal their furry friends.

programme.title: Shark Vs Ross Edgley
programme.desc: Swimmer and shark advocate Ross Edgley faces his greatest challenge yet as he attempts to pit his mind and body against the most formidable predator in the oceanthe shark. Testing the limits of his speed, strength, hydrodynamics and endurance, Ross will push his body to its extremes to understand what makes sharks such incredible and versatile predators.

programme.title: Attack Of The Red Sea Sharks
programme.desc: Sharks have killed 3 tourists in Egypt in less than a year. What brought the sharks into shallow waters, away from their natural hunting grounds? Could mounting pressure from humans be altering how these predators live and hunt? This documentary investigates not just the attacks in the Red Sea, but also other unusual shark encounters around the world, including in Sydney and Florida.

programme.title: Return Of The White Shark
programme.desc: Cape Cod ‚Äî America‚Äôs Playground ‚Äî is a newly emerging hotspot for a top predator. Great Whites are appearing in increasing numbers, when for centuries there were none. Through spectacular imagery, we‚Äôll see how the landscape of Cape Cod has changed over time, and what is luring Great Whites in record numbers.

programme.title: Backyard Bull Shark
programme.desc: Bull sharks are invading in a big way. Found in oceans worldwide, their bullish behavior has made them famous from coast to coast. And the seven seas aren‚Äôt enough, they‚Äôre taking over brackish waters and rivers, too! Warmer waters due to climate change mean bull sharks can expand their range even further‚Ä¶ so the more we learn about them now, the better.

programme.title: Great White vs Tiger Shark
programme.desc: The two biggest of the BIG THREE most dangerous sharks ‚Äì great whites and tiger sharks. And they get BIG ‚Äì up to 20 feet and 18 feet respectively. But where can we find the world‚Äôs biggest? And what is it like to meet these massive creatures face-to-face? Join two teams of shark experts on encounters with some of the largest sharks ever caught on camera, including the famed great white Deep Blue.

programme.title: Sharks Up Close With Bertie Gregory
programme.desc: Bertie heads to South Africa for his most dangerous mission yet. The wild waters here are a hotspot for one of the ocean‚Äôs most famous and fearsome predators: the great white shark. Bertie will attempt to film them hunting seals underwater without the use of a protective cage. It‚Äôs highly risky, but filming without the cage is the very best way to see them behaving naturally.

programme.title: When Sharks Attack... And Why: Compilation
programme.desc: From the Treasure Coast of Florida to Long Island, New York, the beaches of the Atlantic are a playground for swimmers and surfers. The Florida coast is known for its shipwrecks, but gold isn‚Äôt the only thing hiding beneath the waves; sharks injure seven people in one year. In New York, a startling six attacks occur in a three-week period, frightening beachgoers and puzzling experts.

programme.title: Shark Eat Shark
programme.desc: Around the world, reports of shark on shark attacks are on the rise. Now, off South Africa‚Äôs dramatic southern coast a new hotspot has emerged ‚Äì a bay where White Sharks hunt other sharks. In a groundbreaking investigation, Enrico Gennari and Lacey Williams lead a team of experts into the deep to capture conclusive evidence of SHARKS EATING SHARKS!.
